manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Organyc: Complete Protection, No Compromises. 100% Certified Organic Cotton Organyc brand tampons are made with 100% organic cotton inside and out, to give you unsurpassed absorbency and leak protection. Soft and gentle organic cotton is pure, to respect you and your body. Now you don’t have to settle for feminine products that don’t give you the complete protection you need and deserve. Organyc uses patented technology to create certified organic cotton pads, panty liners and tampons that naturally absorb as well as synthetic materials. (patent #s 0001392179, 8946502, 0001398844, 9398983, 0001423392). With Organyc, you can choose the brand that offers complete protection with no compromises on purity or quality. Organyc Cotton Tampons with a Simple, Comfortable Applicator These tampons are breathable and hypoallergenic, with no chlorine bleach, latex, parabens, perfumes, SAP, plastics or man-made materials. Our organic cotton tampons are made for regular use, to give you the confidence and protection you need to go about your day. Organyc brand tampons have a cardboard applicator with soft, rounded edges for superior comfort. Pure Organyc is Your Answer to Reactions from Ordinary Non-Cotton Products Organyc brand tampons are made with 100% organic cotton and are skin pH balanced for complete comfort. Other feminine care products can have bleach and other chemicals that can be harsh on skin. Our 100% cotton is pure, soft, and absorbent, the way nature made it. Organyc respects you and what your body needs. 100% organic cotton inside & out Unsurpassed absorbency Soft and gentle against your skin pH balanced for sensitive skin with no chlorine bleach, latex, parabens, SAP, or man-made materials

Certified Organic Cotton for You and the Environment Our organic cotton is grown using methods and materials with the purpose of reducing the impact on the environment. Organyc proudly displays the 100% cotton seal— in fact, even our packaging is made from recycled material. Respect for the healthy lifestyle you want to lead and respect for our environment is something we take seriously. There is no organic standard for feminine care products, but our organic cotton products have been absorbed into the organic textile category. Our 100% organic cotton is certified by Global Organic Textile Standards, the leading organization for organic textiles (GOTS 2007-005 Ed.03C/Rev.00, Version 5.0, 01.03.2019).

Organyc Brand Certified Organic Cotton Products of All Kinds Organyc is proud to offer a complete range of 100% certified organic products for a range of needs from cotton rounds, to feminine hygiene, to beauty care. In everything we do, we aim to respect you and your body. · Organyc brand tampons for complete protection · Organic cotton tampons with unsurpassed absorbency · pH balanced for sensitive skin · With cardboard applicator for regular daily use · Made with no chlorine bleach, no latex, no parabens, no perfumes, no SAP, and no plastics or man-made materials · 100% certified cotton certified by Global Organic Textile Standards (GOTS 2007-005 Ed.03C/Rev.00, Version 5.0, 01.03.2019) · For women with sensitive skin or reactions to traditional non-cotton feminine care products · Organyc hygiene products are tested and shown to absorb just as well as the traditional brands

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I can not say enough about these. I've use Tampax for decades, but I have recently been making the switch to a more organic/natural/cruelty-free lifestyle. I decided to try organyc tampons because they claim to be organic cotton, cruelty free, bleach free, and hypoallergenic. I didn't even know that the burning and discomfort from tampons was abnormal. These are amazing! I can't tell I have a tampon in, there is NO discomfort or irritation at all. I am a fan already and will never buy a box of mass produced, insecticide filled, bleached tampons again.Pros:I literally can not tell they are in.Comfortable.No irritation.No yeast infections.No dyes/fregrances/or harsh chemicals.Cons:I'm glad I read reviews before purchasing, you MUST twist to separate the two parts of the applicator before attempting to insert.Insertion can be difficult, but patience is key here. I've found that practice does indeed make it much easier to insert. Just slightly start to push the tampon out before inserting, it will make it easier for the tampon to exit the applicator once inside. I will absolutely admit I had to waste one the first use because, yes, they were a bit more difficult to insert.Yes. I would absolutely recommend these to any woman looking for an organic cotton tampon.Yes. I will buy more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2012
reviews.reviewText: I had been purchasing Tampax Pearl, until I went on a natural health product streak when I found out what awful chemicals are in everyday beauty products (not to mention food!). When I realized that cotton was one of the products with the most pesticides, I decided I didn't want pesticides inside my body every month. So I did some research and found these tampons. They are slightly expensive, but they come in a two pack. I usually order a two pack of regular, super and super plus sizes about every 6 months. They have been great and haven't leaked at all! I did like plastic applicators better, but it's a small price to pay. Great product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for heavy bleeders or for overnight protection
reviews.reviewText: I am not a particularly heavy bleeder. I used them for overnight protection (approx 7 hours) and I started to leak. Generally, I found that I had to change them every 2-4 hours. Not too bad for organic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes the best of a bad situation
reviews.reviewText: I don't use tampons very often but there are times when they are called for. My body cannot tolerate the bleached over the counter standard versions and seems to almost reject them. I first found these on a close out sale and decided to buy them and I'm glad I did. I have three boxes and feel secure that when I need one it will be there. Summer is here and I don't want to miss out on a nice beach day because I don't have one. I highly recommend spending a little more to use something like this that I feel is not toxic to my body.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars organic feminine hygiene
reviews.reviewText: I have read different articles about how full of pesticides and insecticides many cotton products are, including tampons. In spite of the higher cost for these, I thought it was worth it to try them. I was pleased. I had read a few reviews saying they are difficult to insert so I was prepared for that. I found that if I twisted the tampon in the applicator first, it was easier to insert. It's sad to have to pay high prices to try to avoid all of the toxins and chemicals being put in everyday products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2012
reviews.reviewText: I needed a tampon and one fast, 7th gen tampons were out of stock so I figured I would try these(thanks to Prime I got them in two days)...we were heading off to the cabin with my husbands family for a week and would be spending time in and around the lake. The cardboard applicators on these things are HORRIBLE!!! they are flimsy, get stuck (meaning you cannot push them up) and crumple and you cant even "apply" the tampon. I am so mad that I bought TWO packs of these tampons. I will never purchase these again! So instead of being prepared I had to run into town and purchase a different brand of non-organic tampons. Dont buy these things ladies, save your money!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This product is extremely uncomfortable to apply and wear. I have never had such a bad experience with tampons before. I will not purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lock and loaded!
reviews.reviewText: I really like this brand of cotton tampons. It absorbs well and the string length is not overly long. It feels great not to put more garbage in my body. We get enough from everything else including the air. Death from above! An old Command & Conquer reference... Listen to General Solomon and get those SAM sites lock and loaded. This tampon is as good as any SAM site for this matter.
